Algorithms.LinkedLists.Python package¶

Submodules¶

Algorithms.LinkedLists.Python.find_loop module¶

Algorithms.LinkedLists.Python.find_loop.has_loop_marking(start)[source]¶

Algorithms.LinkedLists.Python.linked_list module¶

class Algorithms.LinkedLists.Python.linked_list.LinkedList[source]¶
class Cell(value)[source]¶

Class used to store data and links in a linked list.

LinkedList.append(new_value)[source]¶

Adds a new cell to the end of the list.

Args:
new_value: The value to add to the list.
LinkedList.copy()[source]¶

Returns a copy of the linked list.

LinkedList.delete(target)[source]¶

Deletes the cell with the target value from the list.

LinkedList.find(target)[source]¶

Searches for the cell with the given value.

If there are duplicates in the list this returns the first cell with the target value.

Args:
target: value to search for
Returns:
The cell with the target value or None if the value isn’t in the list.
LinkedList.get_bottom()[source]¶

Returns the bottom value.

LinkedList.index(target)[source]¶

Returns the index of the first cell with target value or -1.

LinkedList.insert(idx, new_value)[source]¶

Inserts new_cell after at idx.

Args:
idx (int): The cell to insert after new_value: The new value to insert
LinkedList.insert_sorted(new_value)[source]¶

Inserts a new cell into a sorted list.

This allows you to keep a linked list sorted.

Args:
new_value: The value to insert.
LinkedList.insertion_sort()[source]¶

Returns a sorted list.

LinkedList.prepend(new_value)[source]¶

Adds a new cell to the beginning of the list.

Args:
new_value: The value to add at the beginning.
LinkedList.selection_sort()[source]¶

Returns a sorted list.
